dish_description: The dish is a hearty and flavorful combination of pork and red beans cooked in a pressure cooker, served alongside rice. It incorporates a blend of Puerto Rican and French influences, with ingredients like leek, Italian seasoning, and cilantro stems adding depth to the dish.

cooking_steps.description: Wash half a pound of red beans and place them in the pressure cooker.

Add 3 cups of cold tap water, 1.5 teaspoons of salt, half a cup of tomato, 1.5 pounds of baby back ribs (without the ribs), 4-5 coarsely chopped cloves of garlic, 2 cups of diced onion, and 1 cup of peeled carrots to the pressure cooker.
Include a leek, 1 teaspoon of Italian seasoning, half a teaspoon of cumin powder, and a quarter cup of frozen cilantro stems to the mixture in the pressure cooker.
Add a couple of tablespoons of jalapeno to the pressure cooker, adjusting the amount based on your heat preference.

Close the pressure cooker, bring it to a boil, and wait for the pressure to build up, indicated by the red lines on the gauge. Once the pressure is reached, reduce the heat to very low and cook for 1 hour.

In a separate pot, prepare the rice by combining 1 cup of Carolina regular rice with 2 cups of water and a quarter teaspoon of salt. Bring to a boil, stir a couple of times, then cover and cook on very low heat until done.
After the pressure cooker has cooked for an hour, release the pressure and check the beans and pork for doneness. If necessary, cook for an additional time until the desired tenderness is achieved.
Serve the pork and beans with the cooked rice, fluffing the rice before serving. Garnish with cilantro, a dash of Tabasco, and enjoy.
